title: High Political Stability Sources
description: In 2023, Mexico had 9 sources contributing to its political stability and absence of violence/terrorism, indicating a diverse and robust information base.

title: Low Net Financial Flows from IBRD
description: In 2023, Mexico experienced a negative net financial flow of -$1.21 billion from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD).

title: Minimal Export Tax Revenue
description: In 2022, taxes on exports constituted a negligible 0.0000013% of Mexico's total tax revenue, indicating a minimal reliance on export taxes.

title: Significant Unpaid Domestic Work by Women
description: In 2019, Mexican women spent 27.77% of their day on unpaid domestic and care work, highlighting a significant gender disparity in domestic responsibilities.

title: Effective Diarrhea Treatment for Children
description: In 2015, 79.9% of children under 5 in Mexico received oral rehydration and continued feeding for diarrhea treatment, showcasing effective healthcare practices.

title: Low Net Financial Flows from Multilateral Sources
description: In 2023, Mexico's net financial flows from multilateral sources were negative, amounting to -$1.83 billion, indicating a financial outflow.

title: Negative Financial Flows from Official Creditors
description: In 2023, Mexico faced a negative net financial flow of -$1.74 billion from official creditors, reflecting financial challenges.

title: Low Net Financial Flows from RDB Nonconcessional
description: In 2023, Mexico experienced a negative net financial flow of -$525.9 million from regional development banks' nonconcessional sources.

title: Minimal Arms Exports
description: In 2019, Mexico's arms exports were valued at 1 million SIPRI trend indicator values, indicating a limited role in the global arms trade.

title: Low Bilateral Aid from Luxembourg
description: In 2021, Mexico received $9,999.99 in net bilateral aid flows from Luxembourg, reflecting minimal financial assistance from this donor.

title: Low Political Stability Standard Error
description: In 2023, Mexico had a political stability standard error of 0.205, indicating a relatively stable political environment with low variability.
